results.title: The Beginnings of the cinema
results.creator_credit: National Film Archive (Great Britain) and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: This is a representative collection of short films made between 1896 and 1903, comprising: ‘A Train entering a station’ (from the first Lumiere program); ‘The Derby - on the road to Epsom’, R.W. Paul’s film of the 1896 Derby; ‘The Brighton fire’; ‘Panorama of Calcutta’; ‘The Vanishing lady’; ‘Pienture a L’envers’; ‘The Music eccentric’; ‘A Chess dispute’; and ‘The Miller and the sweep’.

results.creator_credit: Lars Wallen and Sveriges radio aktiebolag

results.title: The Beginning : do you dare to differ?
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion on the role of the creative individual in relation to his society. The non-narrated film describes how one wiggle-man is inspired to do something different from the rest of his companions. Although they ridicule him, the new idea is proven successful, giving the skeptics the courage to try it too.

results.title: The Beggar's opera
results.creator_credit: Peter Brook, Herbert Wilcox, Laurence Olivier and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A feature length production of John Gay’s opera “The Beggar’s opera” with additional dialogue and lyrics by Christopher Fry and music arranged and composed by Sir Arthur Bliss conducted by Muir Mathieson. Co-producer and cast in the lead role, Laurence Olivier plays the dashing and debonair highwayman, Captain Macheath with substance and stylish sex appeal. He is ably supported by a talented cast including Hugh Griffith (the Beggar), Dorothy Tutin (Polly Peachum), Stanley Holloway (Lockit) and Daphne Anderson (Lucy Lockit). Set in early 18th century London, this is not a conventional opera with elaborate Italian arias. Gay has instead satirized the idea of classical opera with light popular tunes and characters of common or criminal background, poking fun throughout at the moral standards of politicians and upper classes of society London in general. The singers include Laurence Olivier, Adele Leigh, Jennifer Vyvyan, Edith Coates, Joan Cross, John Cameron, Bruce Boyne and Stanley Holloway. First performed in 1728 at Lincoln’s Inn Fields Theatre, the film, director Peter Brook’s first feature, when first premiered in 1953, received a luke-warm reception. Audiences were not used to operas being adapted and “tampered” with to suit a cinematic format. However today it is seen as an entertaining musical film, with adventure and romance laced with a good dash of satire.

results.brief_description: Describes the life cycle of the horned beetle, where it is found in nature, and how to feed and care for it in captivity No other credits available.

results.title: The Bedspread
results.creator_credit: Natalie Green, Elizabeth O'Neill and Berry St Film Productions
results.brief_description: Concerns two poverty-stricken women, Mrs Clancy and Mrs Parsons, living in Melbourne during the depression. Mrs Clancy owns a good bedspread, her pride and joy. Mrs Parsons asks to borrow the bedspread in preparation for a visit by a specialist to her sick daughter. This small incident becomes the focal point of the day. Cast includes Janet Robertson, Moira Claux and Kim Deacon. Based on a short story by Iris Simmons.

results.title: The Bedford incident
results.creator_credit: James B. Harris, Richard Widmark, Columbia and Bedford Productions
results.brief_description: During a routine peacetime patrol in the Greenland Straits, the USS Bedford’s sonar picks up an unidentified submarine. The destroyer’s commander, Captain Finlander, (Richard Widmark), relentlessly pursues the lurking sub as a training exercise for his crew, keeping his men at battle stations for hours. Top-flight photo-journalist, Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) and NATO observer Schrepke (Eric Portman), try to warn him about this dangerous game, however Finlander is determined to win at all costs. A gripping “Cold War” classic.

results.title: The Beckoning sea
results.creator_credit: Stephen Kabak and University of California, Los Angeles. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A capsule resume of the forces that a young man feels are oppressing him. Taken from an experimental collection of stories entitled “The Beat Generation and the Angry Young Men”. Short story writer: George Mandel.

results.title: The Beavers break through
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts Association (Great Britain) and Bristol-Cine Society
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of a patrol of British boy scouts, setting up camp, preparing meals, constructing an aerial ropeway across a creek. A girl hiker who has sprained her ankle provides an opportunity for the scouts to work together in a rescue exercise.
